div.ab: To the Greek examples, there can be added a psalm of David of which Sainct Athanase makes mention en in Sinopsi. It begins Parvus eram & in the second versicle the royal prophet says, Manus meae Manus meae fecerunt organum et digiti mei aptarunt psalterium.

div.head: Keeping chestnuts
div.ab: One needs to leave them in their bristled shells until one wants to eat them. And with this, leave them in a humid place or the gutter of some roof.

div.head: Scented candle from Le Mans
div.ab: Among the wax & candle they melt rosin that in France is called of Burgundy, which is white & not as brittle & dry as the other rosin. They also perfume the tip and the wick.

div.head: Softening gold
div.ab: Dissolve caput mortuum in distilled vinegar, filter & congeal in salt, & cement â˜‰ with this, and it softens it marvellously.

div.head: Augmenting the color of gold
div.ab: Put aquafortis of vitriol on hot ashes. Cover the bottle, that is to say, the mouth, with a tile, then unstop it & thick fumes will come out; put the gold on this and it will take on a high color.
